definition: gone forever (idiom)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]

sentences.english: This is a one-way ticket to hell.
sentences.chinese: 这是一条有去无回的死路。

sentences.english: The road to disorder is a one-way street.
sentences.chinese: 通向混乱之路是条有去无回的单行道。

sentences.english: Rural life of the old one-way ticket for a one-way ticket, there is no dress rehearsal.
sentences.chinese: 人生旧乡一张有去无回的单程票，没有彩排。

sentences.english: Financially, that country has passed the point of no return.
sentences.chinese: 从金融角度看，该国已经越过了极限点，有去无回了。

definition: what's gone can never come back
gone forever
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
to lose one's life/to get killed
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end

definition: lit. a lamb in a tiger's den (idiom)/fig. to tread dangerous ground
bottomless pit
to walk right into the trap
everything bodes ill, no positive signs (idiom); inauspicious/everything points to disaster
to lose everything one invested (idiom)/to lose one's shirt
to stake all on one throw

the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
